title: Definitions
context: [ยง474-1] Definitions. For purposes of this chapter, unless the context clearly requires otherwise: &ldquo;Applicant&rdquo; means any person acting on the person&rsquo;s own behalf or who is authorized to act on behalf of any other person for the purpose of securing required permits to engage in business activities in the State. &ldquo;Center&rdquo; means the business action center established in section 474-2. &ldquo;Department&rdquo; means the department of commerce and consumer affairs. &ldquo;Director&rdquo; means the director of commerce and consumer affairs. &ldquo;Permit&rdquo; means any license, certificate, registration, or any other form of authorization required by a federal, state, or county department or agency to engage in any business activity, excluding vocational and professional occupational licenses, certificates, or registration and environmental permits. &ldquo;Person&rdquo; means any individual, proprietorship, partnership, association, cooperative, corporation, nonprofit organization, and any other organization required to obtain one or more permits for the conduct of its business activities. &ldquo;State agency&rdquo; means any department, board, bureau, commission, division, office, council, or agency of the State, a public benefit corporation, or public authority having at least one member appointed by the governor. [L 2005, c 62, pt of ยง2]
